perturbation.original_text: 6.7 SERVICE STANDARDS. i-Escrow will comply with all laws and regulations and act as an Independent Escrow Agent as per the guidelines of California Escrow Law (California Financial Code Section17000 et seq., or its successor). Should any of the terms, conditions or provisions of this Agreement conflict with the California Escrow Law, its rules or regulations, which govern i-Escrow's business practices, the California Escrow Law shall prevail. Notwithstanding the foregoing, at any time that i-Escrow reasonably believes such a conflict exists, i-Escrow will give 2TheMart written notice of such conflict and the parties will use their best efforts to resolve such conflict.
perturbation.changed_text: 6.7 SERVICE STANDARDS. i-Escrow will use reasonable efforts to comply with laws and regulations. Should any of the terms, conditions or provisions of this Agreement conflict with any law or regulation, i-Escrow will give 2TheMart written notice of such conflict.
perturbation.explanation: This modification removes the explicit requirement for i-Escrow to comply with California Escrow Law and weakens the standard to 'reasonable efforts'. It also removes the clause ensuring that California Escrow Law prevails in case of conflict. This introduces legal risk because it potentially allows i-Escrow to operate outside the bounds of mandatory consumer protections provided by California law.
perturbation.law_explanation: California Financial Code Section 17202 mandates specific fidelity bond requirements for escrow agents to protect consumers from fraud and dishonesty. By weakening the obligation to comply with California Escrow Law, this contract potentially circumvents these mandatory consumer protections, allowing i-Escrow to operate with less stringent financial safeguards.

perturbation.original_text: 7. DISCLAIMER OF WARRANTIES. EACH PARTY PROVIDES ALL MATERIALS AND SERVICES TO THE OTHER PARTY "AS IS." EACH PARTY DISCLAIMS ALL WARRANTIES AND CONDITIONS, EXPRESS, IMPLIED OR STATUTORY, INCLUDING WITHOUT LIMITATION THE IMPLIED WARRANTIES OF TITLE, NON- INFRINGEMENT, MERCHANTABILITY ANDFITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE. Each party acknowledges that it has not entered into this Agreement in reliance upon any warranty or representation except those specifically set forth herein.
perturbation.changed_text: 7. DISCLAIMER OF WARRANTIES. EACH PARTY PROVIDES ALL MATERIALS AND SERVICES TO THE OTHER PARTY "AS IS." EACH PARTY DISCLAIMS ALL WARRANTIES AND CONDITIONS, EXPRESS OR IMPLIED. Each party acknowledges that it has not entered into this Agreement in reliance upon any warranty or representation except those specifically set forth herein.
perturbation.explanation: By removing 'STATUTORY' from the warranty disclaimer, the contract attempts to disclaim warranties implied by law, including the implied warranty of merchantability and fitness for a particular purpose. This introduces legal risk by attempting to circumvent consumer protection laws that provide these statutory warranties.
perturbation.law_explanation: California Commercial Code Section 2314 establishes the implied warranty of merchantability in sales contracts. Removing the disclaimer of 'statutory' warranties could be interpreted as an attempt to disclaim this legally mandated warranty, which is often deemed unenforceable in consumer contracts, especially if unconscionable.

perturbation.original_text: 9. INDEMNITY. Each party (the "Indemnifying Party") shall indemnify the other party (the "Indemnified Party") against any and all claims, losses, costs and expenses, including reasonable attorneys' fees, which the Indemnified Party may incur as a result of claims in any form by third parties arising from the Indemnifying Party's acts, omissions or misrepresentations to the extent that the Indemnified Party is deemed a principal of the Indemnifying Party. In addition, 2TheMart shall indemnify i-Escrow against any and all claims, losses, costs and expenses, including reasonable attorneys' fees, which i-Escrow may incur as a result of claims in any form by third parties arising from 2TheMart Content. In addition, i-Escrow shall indemnify 2TheMart against any and all claims, losses, costs and expenses, including reasonable attorneys' fees, which 2TheMart may incur as a result of claims in any form by third parties arising from i-Escrow Content and or the Services provided to Customers. The foregoing obligations are conditioned on the Indemnified Party: (i) giving the Indemnifying Party notice of the relevant claim, (ii) cooperating with the Indemnifying Party, at the Indemnifying Party's expense, in the defense of such claim, and (iii) giving the Indemnifying Party the right to control the defense and settlement of any such claim, except that the Indemnifying Party shall not enter into any settlement that affects the Indemnified Party's rights or interest without the Indemnified Party's prior written approval. The Indemnified Party shall have the right to participate in the defense at its expense.
perturbation.changed_text: 9. INDEMNITY. Each party (the "Indemnifying Party") shall indemnify the other party (the "Indemnified Party") against any and all claims, losses, costs and expenses, including reasonable attorneys' fees, which the Indemnified Party may incur as a result of claims in any form by third parties arising from the Indemnifying Party's acts, omissions or misrepresentations to the extent that the Indemnified Party is deemed a principal of the Indemnifying Party. The foregoing obligations are conditioned on the Indemnified Party: (i) giving the Indemnifying Party notice of the relevant claim, (ii) cooperating with the Indemnifying Party, at the Indemnifying Party's expense, in the defense of such claim, and (iii) giving the Indemnifying Party the right to control the defense and settlement of any such claim, except that the Indemnifying Party shall not enter into any settlement that affects the Indemnified Party's rights or interest without the Indemnified Party's prior written approval. The Indemnified Party shall have the right to participate in the defense at its expense.
perturbation.explanation: This change removes the specific indemnity obligations for 2TheMart regarding claims arising from 2TheMart Content, and for i-Escrow regarding claims arising from i-Escrow Content and Services. Under California law, businesses have a duty to ensure their content and services do not harm consumers. By removing these indemnification clauses, the agreement weakens the consumer's ability to seek recourse from either party for damages caused by content or services.
perturbation.law_explanation: California Civil Code Section 1714 establishes the general principle that individuals are responsible for injuries caused by their lack of ordinary care or skill in the management of their property or person. By removing the specific indemnification clauses, the agreement may attempt to limit liability in a way that contradicts this fundamental principle, potentially harming consumers who suffer damages due to negligence related to the content or services provided under this agreement.
